intro: Securigera charadzeae, commonly known as the Georgian senna, is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its seed pods are distinctive, often containing several small, hard seeds. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species in its native habitat.
